lexUnit.name: tiring.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: exhausting the interest or patience of

sentence.text: It had been , I realized , an extremely long and tiring day .
The soldiers had found it a long and tiring period .
This strange and very tiring event , designed by the church youth worker , began with a series of strange and tiring games .
This strange and very tiring event , designed by the church youth worker , began with a series of strange and tiring games .
Squeezing strokes help restore you after a tiring day by alleviating tension from tight , sore muscles .
Cheesemaking by hand is a long and tiring process -- it sounds idyllic but is very hard , physical work .
Saturday was always the most tiring day for Agnes .
I remember , and I also remember that it is a very tiring work .
The mood on Kinnock 's ` Red Rose " jet was subdued after a tiring day , most of his entourage and press contingent longing for bed .
` Yes , but it 's difficult , it 's very tiring .
If he has a tiring morning session , for instance , he may need a rest period in his chair or in bed after lunch .
Uphauling in stronger winds , as well as being extremely difficult , is very tiring and often frustrating .
And a tiring mind can know no rest . "
Despite a long day of rehearsals , and a long tiring performance , Gracie was the life of the party , and her homey Lancashire friendliness made everyone love her .
It can be very tiring , and she has to adapt constantly to the changing needs of the learner , patient and ward .
Green also anxiously records bouts of measles , his youngest son Thomas having fits as a baby , and Joshua being troubled with erysipelas , which made for a tiring journey for him back to Keswick .
From time to time the ` mothers " need renewing and the simple answer is to turn the nearest two-year-old shoot in full circle and bury it next to the tiring parent .
I 've been waiting all this time for a baby , but I must admit the carrying of it is more tiring than I 'd expected . "
We 've had a long and tiring journey and my wife is not well . "
It 's less tiring because otherwise you 've got to come in during the afternoon , then you have to decide whether to go back to the hotel or stay at the show .
He raised the pace near the end to punish the tiring Windies attack .
They therefore received the doubtful honour of pouring out for some two hundred ladies , regardless of the fact that it was a very arduous and tiring task .
He had had a long and tiring journey , flights from Frankfurt , Heathrow and Glasgow all having been delayed or cancelled .
The hosts , and what a superbly organised lot they were , with the help of few French travellers , gave a good account of themselves , notably against the tiring Irish .
Progress is inevitably slower and more tiring and a bulky pack may make difficult terrain even more demanding , sometimes dangerously so .
The local name comes from the loud braying call which is always at its loudest at four o'clock in the morning , just when you are looking for a bit more sleep after a tiring day .
It had been a long , tiring business and his hands were sore and chafed from the ropes .
Long periods of continuous study are very tiring .
It was very tiring work , and it kept me busy so that I did not look up and see the Hispaniola until she was just half a mile away from me !
` It was a tiring job .
It did mean that keeping the Seayak on a bearing in a big sea was a somewhat tiring and frustrating battle .
The farmer put Tess next to the threshing-machine , so that she had the hardest and most tiring job of all .
Omar and I had a tiring discussion with him , beset by clouds of flies .
It had been a tiring day , largely because it had been so unproductive .
The events had been very tiring and we were glad to find our beds that night .
He was conscious of a growing feeling of peace and well-being as he drew nearer -- like a weary traveller returning home after a long and tiring journey .
It was tiring work , leaving no time to think of what they had left behind , or what might lie ahead of them .
